meaning_cn: 正当合理的，合情合理的
definition: for which there is a fair and acceptable reason
example: Politicians are legitimate targets for satire.

definition: in large quantities; large
example: State aid is less bountiful than it was before.

definition: kind, helpful and generous
example: The company has proved to be a most benevolent employer.

definition: to keep someone or something inside the limits of a particular activity, subject, area, etc.
example: The work will not be confined to the Glasgow area.

definition: to consider that something is caused by a particular thing or person
example: He ascribed his failure to bad luck.

definition: a correlation in which large values of one variable are associated with small values of the other; the correlation coefficient is between 0 and -1
having the value zero
example: A spokeswoman said the agreement had been declared null and void.

definition: a statement that says that something is not true
example: She issued a point-by-point rebuttal of the company's accusations.

definition: to move about or travel, especially without a clear idea of what you are going to do
example: After the bars close, gangs of youths roam the city streets.

definition: to force someone to leave a particular place
example: A number of fans had been ejected from the bar for causing trouble.

meaning_cn: 光线暗的，暗淡的，昏暗的
definition: not giving or having much light
example: We could see a dim shape in the fog.

definition: an idea or opinion
example: They were debating the proposition that "All people are created equal".

definition: cause a severe and almost insuperable problem for
example: Developing countries are crippled by their debts.

definition: a way of achieving an aim or solving a problem by trying a number of different methods and learning from mistakes
example: There's no instant way of finding a cure - it's just a process of trial and error.

meaning_cn: 通过归纳得出的普遍、笼统的观点
definition: a written or spoken statement in which you say that something is true all of the time when it is only true some of the time
example: The report is full of errors and sweeping generalizations.

definition: the beginning or first signs of something
example: Peace marked a new dawn in the country's history.

definition: all the animals living in an area or in a particular period of history

meaning_cn: （某地区、环境或时期的）植物群
definition: the plants of a particular area, type of environment or period of time
example: We have to protect the local flora and fauna.

definition: to understand that something is true
example: What I failed to appreciate was the distance between the two cities.

meaning_cn: 任某人处理，供某人任意使用，由某人自行支配
definition: available for use as you prefer
example: He will have a car at his disposal for the whole month.

definition: that has become very famous, like someone or something in a myth
example: Scott of the Antarctic was a national hero of mythic proportions.

definition: to keep following someone and not leave them alone, especially to get something from them or ask them questions
example: They were hounded day and night by the press.

definition: to show no respect for something
example: The new exam mocked the needs of the majority of children.

definition: a god or goddess
example: Ares and Aphrodite were the ancient Greek deities of war and love.

definition: the product or result of something
example: German nationalism was the offspring of military ambition.

definition: extremely large
example: She had a whopping great bruise on her arm.

definition: to take someone or something or make someone or something go in the direction in which you want them to go
example: I'd like to steer our discussion back to our original topic.

definition: the area around a place or where the speaker is
example: There are several hotels in the immediate vicinity of the station.

definition: to lose the determination to oppose something; to accept defeat
example: I felt sure it would only be a matter of time before he succumbed to my charms.

meaning_cn: （有别于职业军队的）民兵部队
definition: a military force whose members are trained soldiers but who often have other jobs
example: A UN force was sent in to stop fighting between three rival militias.

meaning_cn: 过得去的，合意的，舒适的，满意的
definition: of an acceptable standard; satisfactory
example: Everyone should be entitled to a decent wage/standard of living.

definition: the traditional stories and culture of a group of people
example: Her books are often based on folklore and fairy-tales.

definition: make something appear less important than it really is
example: This report downplays the seriousness of global warming.

definition: used to describe feelings that two or more people have for each other equally, or actions that affect two or more people equally
example: I don't like her, and I think the feeling is mutual.

meaning_cn: 分散注意力的事，使人分心的事
definition: a thing that takes your attention away from what you are doing or thinking about
example: I find it hard to work at home because there are too many distractions.

definition: to strongly encourage someone to do something that might not be a very good idea
example: Don't egg him on! He gets himself into enough trouble without your encouragement.

meaning_cn: 偶尔发生的，间或出现的，阵发性的，断断续续的
definition: happening only occasionally or at intervals that are not regular
example: More than 100 people have been killed this year in sporadic outbursts of ethnic violence.

definition: to refuse to accept something or someone as true, good, or reasonable
example: He repudiated the allegation that he had tried to deceive them.

definition: requiring or using great exertion
example: The government made strenuous efforts to upgrade the quality of the teaching profession.

definition: to say what should be done or how something should be done
example: The prescribed form must be completed and returned to this office.

meaning_cn: 衣服（尤用于衣服生产和销售的领域）
definition: a piece of clothing; used especially in contexts where you are talking about the manufacture or sale of clothes
example: Many of the garments have the customers' name tags sewn into the linings.

definition: to explain the reason for something or the cause of something
example: Rural Americans are often older than those in other parts of America and that may account for the slower adoption rates for internet access.

definition: to prevent someone doing something easily
example: Fierce storms have been hampering rescue efforts and there is now little chance of finding more survivors.

definition: to show something or to say or prove that something is true
example: The number of old German cars still on the road attests to the excellence of their manufacture.
